bibl.title: Memory and Microhistory of an Empire: Domestic Contexts in Roman Amheida, Egypt.
bibl.note: Paper read at the conference 'Excavating Memories: The Archaeology of Remembering and Forgetting' held at the Center for Archaeology at Columbia University, April 26th-27th, 2003. - Introduction. - Conceptions of memory. - Memory and imperialism. - Memory and domestic contexts. - Amheida (Ancient Trimithis). - Greek memories in Roman Egypt: A microhistory. - Hybrid memories in Roman Egypt: A microhistory. - Conclusion.
bibl.seg: Anna Lucille Boozer, Memory and Microhistory of an Empire: Domestic Contexts in Roman Amheida, Egypt.
Dušan Borič (ed.), Archaeology and Memory (Oxford, 2010) pp. 138-157, 9 figg.

Paper read at the conference 'Excavating Memories: The Archaeology of Remembering and Forgetting' held at the Center for Archaeology at Columbia University, April 26th-27th, 2003. - Introduction. - Conceptions of memory. - Memory and imperialism. - Memory and domestic contexts. - Amheida (Ancient Trimithis). - Greek memories in Roman Egypt: A microhistory. - Hybrid memories in Roman Egypt: A microhistory. - Conclusion.
